info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 7 at 3:16PM MST until September 7 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, east central Santa Cruz.
* WHEN...Until 515 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a slow moving thunderstorm east of Patagonia. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.8 and 1.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.7 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Patagonia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
